title: Famous Fountains Quiz
description: From ancient Roman waterworks to dazzling modern displays, test your knowledge of the world's most famous fountains.

questions.question: The Trevi Fountain in Rome is the largest Baroque fountain in the city. Tradition says tossing a coin ensures what?
The Bellagio Fountains, famous for their choreographed water shows, are located in which city?
The Jet d'Eau, a large fountain in Lake Geneva shooting water 140 meters high, is a symbol of which city?
The Fountain of Neptune in Florence, Italy, features a large marble statue of the Roman god standing on what?
options: A chariot pulled by sea horses

questions.question: King Fahd's Fountain in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, is the tallest fountain in the world. How high can it shoot water?
The Buckingham Fountain in Chicago's Grant Park was inspired by a fountain in which European palace?
The Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers) in Rome's Piazza Navona was designed by which artist?
The Dubai Fountain, the world's largest choreographed fountain system, is located at the base of which landmark?
The Manneken Pis, a small bronze fountain sculpture of a urinating boy, is a famous landmark in which city?
The Samson Fountain at Peterhof Palace shoots a jet of water 20 meters high. The palace is near which Russian city?
The Stravinsky Fountain in Paris, featuring colorful moving sculptures, is located next to which cultural center?
The Merlion fountain, depicting a mythical creature with a lion's head and a fish's body, is the symbol of which city?
The Magic Fountain of Montjuïc in Barcelona provides a spectacular show combining water, light, and what?
The Archibald Fountain in Sydney's Hyde Park was gifted to Australia by France to commemorate the alliance during which war?
The Swann Memorial Fountain in Philadelphia features three Native American figures representing what?
options: The three major rivers of Philadelphia
